data.title: Featured Items
data.meta_description: Browse all featured items Crow Hop Rare Books
data.text:
1950s-1980s Collection of Santa/Christmas Research and Unpublished Typescripts belonging to Evelyn Cole of W. Englewood, NJ.

An impressive collection (more than 300 individual pieces) containing unpublished manuscript/lectures and research material on Christmas around the world and the history of St. Nicholas. Typed manuscripts include: The Celebration of Christmas (10 pp.); Tree of Light and Life—Our Christmas Tree (7 pp.); A Visit From St. Nicholas (3 pp.);..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $250.00

1960s Beatles Scrapbook

Folio, approximately 12” x 14.5”. Powder blue pictorial front cover detached but present. Overall VG or better. Contents point to 1964-1965. 54 pp. Magazine and newspaper articles and images affixed to pages (mostly pasted or glued), both rectos and versos, with a few loose 16 Magazine (January 1965) articles laid..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $100.00

1970s Photo Album of U.S. Post Office Employee Fred Montgomery

9.5” x 11.5” red cloth boards, ringbound, with “Photo Album” on front. Soiling and minor scuffing. 9 leaves. Contents (some loose, others under protective plastic sheets) include: six 8” x 10” black and white photographs of group shots of post office personnel, including two labled “Oklahoma Postal Training Operations (Norman..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $175.00

1980s Russian Photo Album

Illustrated floral design with some light wear to covers. 21 leaves, all but three filled with 86 (mostly) black and white photographs of various sizes, affixed to pages (recto and verso), plus two additional loose photos laid in. The album covers the years 1980-1986 and is split into two distinct..... More

Price: $275.00

Advertisement Card for The Jubilee King Gospel Singers

817 Grehm Avenue, Winston-Salem, N.C. Approximately 8” x 6.5” with black and white image of the five-piece group centered (Andrew Williams, Henry C. Boyd, James Leak, George Bryant, Mgr., Taft Bryant). Heavy soiling on both sides, rubbing, water damage and handwritten notation to bottom edge. African American gospel groups like Jubilee..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $100.00

Al Jay Collection. Memphis, TN. 1990s.

25 pieces total—handwritten lyrics, his EP, plus 2 drawings—by Memphis musical artist Al Jay (real name Al James) from the early 1990s. Edgy R&B/funk/rap/disco/hip hop fusion sound. Listen at https://www.reverbnation.com/aljay12. Lyrics include “DoTha Gangsta Dance,” “Big O Studd U,” “I’m Just a Getto Man,” “It’s X Rated,” and “Slippen In..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $7,000.00

Black Call; Volume 5, Number 5. December 18, 1970

Los Angeles City College. Black Student Union. 9 pp. with photographs, folded (8.5” x 12”). Good (chipping and wear, tears at folds, horizontal fold). A publication of the Black Student Union at Los Angeles City College. Articles on the upcoming Black Culture Week, an Editorial, Letters to the Editor, cartoons..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $350.00

Collection of Bar-Kays Material 1970s/early 1980s

Material belonging to Charlie Allen, trumpeter in the funk/soul band Bar-Kays (formed in 1964 in Memphis). Includes handwritten lyrics, musical arrangements, letters, band biography, postcards (one addressed to Ruby Wilson), show notes, 1974 hotel reservations and tour schedule, plus a few photos. The Bar-Kays had a number of hits, including..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $1,750.00

Collection of French Champagne Labels. 1970-1990s

More than 1,850 individual labels, loose (early 1980s well represented). Hundreds of unique designs, with duplicates, as well as a number with color variations. VG to Fine. A visually-appealing record of France's champagne industry in the late 20th century. More

Add to Cart

Price: $750.00

D.C. Nine Armband. 1969

Red cloth, approximately 6.5” x 18” with white lettering. Armband likely worn in support of the D.C. Nine. According to the Zinn Education Project: “In March 22, 1969, nine protesters [eight of the nine were Roman Catholic priests, nuns, and seminarians] smashed glass, hurled files out a fourth floor window..... More

Price: $400.00

Early 18th Century Military Fortification Card Game published in Amsterdam; Das Festung Baues Spiel (The Fortress Building Game)

Illustrated uncut sheet on rag paper (no watermark visible), sepia-toned, measuring approximately 25.25” x 21”. Im Verlag und zufinden bey Peter Schencken (Amsterdam, circa 1705). Originally published in Paris in the seventeenth century, with a few variations listed in OCLC, mostly appearing in European institutions (one appears at Harvard). Half-inch loss to..... More

Price: $1,000.00

First Annual Report of the State Board of Health of the State of Rhode Island, for the Year Ending Dec. 31, 1878

Providence: E.L. Freeman & Co., Printers to the State, 1879. 200 pp. Tipped in sheet at ffep that reads, “With the compliments of The Secretary of the State Board of Health, Office 17 College St., Providence, R.I.” Brown boards, blindstamped with the word “Hope” and anchor symbol, spine title in..... More

Price: $200.00

The Great Physician Vol. 1-No. 1; (Cover title reads “Healing Faith”)

Lenoir City, Tennessee: [n.p.], 1949. VG+ or better pictorial stapled wraps. A publication focusing on Brother Earl Ivie (1906-1970) and his wife Sister Una E. Ivie, “the Evangelist’s Helpmate:” “The Ivie family has been ministering to the suffering for many years. Evangelist Ivie manifests all nine gifts of the Holy..... More

Price: $175.00

Late 1970s Broadside “Why Have These Federal Agencies Been Harassing The Black Panther Party and Huey P. Newton? Because They Don’t Like What the Black Panther Party Has Been Doing!”

One page, double-sided, printed in black and red, with three photographs highlighting the Black Panther Party “Survival Programs” meant “to provide Black and poor people with decent food, clothing, medical care, education, and other basic needs.” The broadside calls out the FBI, ATF, CIA, and IRS as federal agencies targeting..... More

Price: $175.00

The Liberator. Complete Run for 1922-1923

A complete run from 1922 and 1923 of this important socialist magazine edited by Max Eastman and Floyd Dell. New York: Liberator Publishing Co., [1922, 1923]. 23 issues (Nov-Dec 1922 is combined in one issue). There is a small "Jan. 1922" stamp on one of the opening pages of first..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $1,250.00

Mel O Lox 1954 Broadside Poster for African American Hair Products

“Waterproofs and Reconditions the Hair. Immediate Results. From Hollywood…the secret of…Non-Greasy Light and Fluffy Pressed Hair For You! Sparkling Brilliant Diamond Studded Hair.” Crème Press. Trio Shampoo. Scalp Crème. Broadside measuring 11” x 17”. VG or better (toning and edgewear, light central crease, loss to bottom corner). Scarce midcentury advertising..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $750.00

New York City’s own Midnight Records/J.D. Martignon Collection from the 1980s

An outstanding collection of ephemeral material (approximately 200 separate pieces) from the New York City record store/record label Midnight Records from the years 1984-1989. Midnight Records was founded by J.D. Martignon (who died in 2016), a French record dealer who has been called “the mover and shaker” behind the 1980s..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $3,900.00

Nommo; Vol. 4 No. 6. March 8, 1972

Sonja Walker, Editor-in-Chief. Cover Design by Susan Cook. 16 pp. Masthead has images of Angela Davis and Malcolm X. VG+ (toning, horizontal fold). According to their website, “Nommo is the Afrikan Newsmagazine at UCLA. It draws its name from the Ki-Swahili term Nommo, which means the magical power of the word..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $300.00

The Official 1980 Mr. Gay America Pageant Souvenir Program; Atlanta Cabana Hotel, July 26-27, 1980

48 pp. 5.5” x 8.5” in stapled pictorial wraps. Includes sections on contestants, photos, and many advertisements. VG+. “Practically all of Atlanta’s hot night spots are represented in this program. You can take it from us, the clubs and the men here are like nowhere else.” No copies found in OCLC. More

Price: $150.00

Operation Bootstrap. A Glass House Shattered. By Edwin Baldwin. An Original Play About Watts

Directed by Herman James. Illustrated flyer (8.5” x 11”). Edgewear, small stain at top edge, with “T-Th 4pm 2/10/68” written in blue ink in top right corner. A one act play in two scenes developed and copyrighted in November 1966, a little over a year after the Watts Riots..... More

Price: $350.00

Out of Eastern Star Kitchens; Our Favorites: Recipes Compiled by Members of Maine Chapter O.E.S. #599

[n.p.]: [n.p.], [n.d.]. Circa 1970. Thick board covers, string tied. About VG+ (soiling to covers and toning to pages--a few of the first pages are detached). 128 pp. Spirit duplicated handwritten recipes with illustrations. Contains sections on Breads, Cakes, Cookies, Pies, Puddings, Casserole Dishes, Canning, and This and That. Recipes..... More

Price: $125.00

What Color is Black? Poster

New York: Negro Digest/Black World/Scholastic, 1969. 17” x 22”. VG (horizontal and vertical folds, as issued, with wear at folds). Image of eyes accompanied by the poem “What Color is Black” by Barbara D. Mahone (“black is the color of / the feeling that we share / the love we..... More

Add to Cart

Price: $175.00

Worn Placards from Eastern Airlines Strike, Atlanta, 1989.

Each approximately 14.5” x 22” with two holes at top of each for string to be worn around neck. Eight placards total (one duplicate), one with hand-written message in marker on reverse; seven printed (all with “We Support the IAM” and marked with the Allied Printing Trades Council Union Label..... More

Asimov, Isaac

The End of Eternity

Garden City, NY: Doubleday, 1955. First Edition. 191 pp. VG+ black cloth with spine lettering in red (rubbing, toning to endpapers) in a VG unclipped dustjacket (wrinkling at rear top edge, sticker stain on front flap, tiny losses at folds and edgewear). More
